meanings.definition: To visit or spend time at a place often
meanings.sent1: She enjoys frequenting the library to read books.
meanings.sent2: He is always frequenting the local coffee shop for his morning caffeine fix.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was frequenting the bird feeder, much to the annoyance of the birds.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts kept frequenting the memories of her childhood home.
meanings.sent5: The old lighthouse stood lonely, its steps frequenting only by the wind and sea spray.

meanings.definition: To be a regular visitor to a place
meanings.sent1: The elderly couple enjoys frequenting the park for their daily walks.
meanings.sent2: Students often frequent the campus cafeteria between classes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was frequenting the neighbor's garden, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: His dreams were frequenting the same haunted house, night after night.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the song kept frequenting his mind, refusing to fade away.
